[{'title': 'Dar-Alakhbar', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'description': 'Dar-Alakhbar crawls news websites in the Saudi market and automatically constructs news stories from the related articles from hundreds of different websites. The store was founded by a former Amazon employee and was later acquired by Amazon. As well as selling books and eBooks they also have a large number of books in the Public Domain available for free download.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ahmad', 'last_name': 'Bakr', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Software Engineer at Uber'}]}, {'title': 'Akhbarak', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'Akhbrak is an online news aggregator with approx 4 million unique visitors. Akhbarak was recently acquired by Sarmady. Akhbarak -accroding to StartupRanking.com- was ranked 1st on Egypt and 18th globally (Sept 2013). My main contributions to Akhbarak are:

1- Develop a robust intelligent engine for news crawling, clustering and categorization relaying on recent machine learning and text mining algorithms.  
2-Achieved 70% speedup in the backend modules through developing concurrent computing algorithms for news crawling, clustering and categorization.
3- Achieved 30% speedup in the pages loading time through developing advanced caching and content optimization
techniques (i.e HTTP compression, image optimization and decreasing HTTP requests).
4- Developed robust and rich Restful APIs to be used by hundreds of external websites.
5- Implemented features for front-end and backend, adding analytics and measure data about users behaviors. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ahmad', 'last_name': 'Bakr', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Software Engineer at Uber'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ahmed', 'last_name': 'Shahin', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Software Engineer at GitHub'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Assem', 'last_name': 'Emam', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Co-founder and CEO at ElCoach'}]}, {'title': 'Extracting and Analysis of micro RNAs of Hepatocellular Carcinomas from Real Data of Egyptian Population', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'The project is funded by the Science and Technology Development Fund Agency (STDF). news sources.

1- Revamping the registration process: Unifying the seller and buyer registration into one registration process that eliminated much of the confusion and resulted 16% uplift in the number of registrations. 
2- Authentication: Changing the way we handle authentication and login to match the current quality standards.
3- Catawiki Messaging Center: Developedthe underlying structure for a chatting system between the sellers, the buyer and the auctioneersfor Catawiki. Exposed restful API for mobile usage as well.
4- Catawiki Push Notifications: Developed a microservice for handling all push notifications (web and mobile) for Catawiki. This includes queuing systems and connecting to push notifications providers such as Firebase and Localytics.

This includes developing neural networks and restful API to be consumed by the frontend team.', 'title': 'Lead Software Engineer', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 47584, 'name': 'Rakuten', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D560BAQFvXOZRDUWEzQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1688341703670?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=lVkgeI53iupxpeu9mDNUTU-6HuZcw2ZdTdtpZ21GpaU', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/rakuten/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Tokyo, Japan', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'company': 'Rakuten', 'description': "Rakuten is the biggest e-commerce player in Japan and one of the biggest online retail in the world. I work with a diverse team to build and maintain Rakuten's Core Services that are being used by every project in Rakuten and accessed by more than 900 million users around the world.

My major achievements: 

1- Contributed in designing, developing and testing over 300 restful APIs. 
2- Designed and developed API Exception Handling Framework to handle exceptions across the whole platform. The outcome is a clean way based on separation of concerns concept(AOP)between the APIs and theexceptions responses.
3- Dockerizing the whole development environment. Allows one click setup for all the development environment components and an easy way to test/handle partial failures. The outcome is a more productive development environment that allows engineers to focus on their current task and not to worry about other components of the platform.
4- Having Flume to analyze the logs and detect major log events. The outcome is a systematic way to trace application failures.
5- Developing asynchronized background workers platform based on RabbitMQ and AmazonSQS to handle communications between IDC platform and major group companies such as Viber and Ebates.", 'title': 'Senior Software Engineer / Tech Lead', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1586, 'name': 'Amazon', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHTvZwCx4p2Qg/company-logo_400_400/0/1612205615891?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=Q0RgGaA8-MTNvpy9u4tPvV9WN4o-Glzw-k7O_LShMeI', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/amazon/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'United Kingdom', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'Amazon', 'description': "Being an Amazon's subsidiary, The Book Depository is a UK-based online bookseller with a large catalogue offered with free shipping to over 160 countries.

My work includes designing and developing scalable distributed applications based on the Java Spring framework, writing varies tests (unit, integration and performance) to ensure the integrity and correctness as well as participating in code reviewing for providing accuracy, maintainability, security and stability.

 During my work, I have implemented these projects:

1- Amazon Competitor Reactor: A distributed service that communicates with Amazon MWS to react quickly for any price or offer change made by our competitors for any book title we list on Amazon's marketplaces. The service is built with a distributed/parallel architecture to process up to 100 million notifications daily. Technologies include Spring Framework, Amazon SQS queues, DynamoDB and MySQL.

2- Amazon Upload Tool: A tool that processes, validates and uniforms outputs of different internal systems and communicates with Amazon MWS for uploading new changes based on an assigned priority. Technologies include Spring, Spring Batch, Amazon SQSs and MySQL.", 'title': 'Software Development Engineer II', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 268822, 'name': 'Faculty of Engineering, Alexandria University, Egypt', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQE2PJJV3mCemg/company-logo_400_400/0/1519910403393?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=1fONgxNOboO_N9J41_T6Fg7svObu3h_-0VdhkWP6osE', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/faculty-of-engineering-alexandria-university-egypt/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Alexandria, Egypt', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'Faculty of Engineering, Alexandria University, Egypt', 'description': 'I am working as a TA for pattern recognitions and machine learning courses. Working as a software engineer with crazy and ambitious team, we managed to bring Akhbarak from a startup to a big acquisition by telecom giant Vodafone Egypt.  

Among awesome things which I am proud of through working at Akhbarak.net:

1- Achieved 40% speedup in the backend through developing concurrent algorithms for news crawling, clustering and categorization.

2- Achieved 30% speedup in the page loading time through developing advanced caching and content optimization techniques.

3- Designed and implemented an algorithm for news clustering engine that groups similar news articles into clusters. The engine provides an easy way for users to navigate different news.The algorithm was published at ICPR 2012 conference in Tuskuba, Japan.

4- Keyword extraction system based on Wikipedia. The system maps text to indexed Wikipedia pages and ranks matched pages based on its relatedness to the text.

5- Developed robust and rich Restful APIs to be used by of external websites. 

6- Modify the backend of Akhbarak to process English news and developing new frontend for the English version.', 'title': 'Junior/Senior Software Development Engineer', 'employment_type': None}]}]
